Javadoc for phylo3D

phylo3D is a set of packages for converting phylogenetic trees in New Hampshire (also called Newick or Phylip) format, New Hampshire Extended and the NCBI taxonomy database into LibSea format.

See:
          Description

Packages
phylo3D.datafiles This package contains functionality for updating the standard data files.
phylo3D.imaging This package contains functionality for handling Walrus tree colouring information and for producing the legend image files that contain the colouring information in a visual form.
phylo3D.parser.ncbi This package contains functionality for parsing the NCBI taxonomy database flatfiles into java objects.
phylo3D.parser.nexus  
phylo3D.parser.taxonomy  
phylo3D.tools This package contains the tool classes i.e. the classes with main methods called by the user.
phylo3D.trees This package contains all the main data structure classes i.e. trees and their nodes.
phylo3D.utilities This package contains various utility functionality: file operations, debug methods and constants.

 

phylo3D is a set of packages for converting phylogenetic trees in New Hampshire (also called Newick or Phylip) format, New Hampshire Extended and the NCBI taxonomy database into LibSea format. LibSea format can be read by Walrus a java-based graph visualization tool that can visualise graphs with several thousand nodes in 3D hyperbolic space. Thus, phylo3D makes it possible to visualise "huge" phylogenetic trees in 3D hyperbolic space. The advantage of visualising huge trees in this way is that it provides a focus+context view of the tree. Walrus was developed by Young Hyun at the Cooperative Association for Internet Data Analysis (CAIDA) and is available in binary form upon request from CAIDA.
